metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1287 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Blink, as used in Google Chrome before 44.0.2403.89, enables a quirks-mode exception that limits the cases in which a Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) document is required to have the text/css content type, which allows remote attackers to bypass the Same Origin Policy via a crafted web site, related to core/fetch/CSSStyleSheetResource.cpp.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1287` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
chromium-browser-l10n - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
chromium-chromedriver - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1095').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
